subject: RE: [junit] does junit.textui.TestRunner.run return a non zero st atus code? ( junit & ant problem)
msgSnippet: Yes.  This looks EXACTLY like what I was looking for.  I was also having a problems identical to what you described in the messages below.  I appreciate your
messageBody:
Yes. This looks EXACTLY like what I was looking for. I was also
having a problems identical to what you described in the messages
below. I appreciate your help.

Let me ask, is this junit-functionaltests another mailing list?
What's it for?

Perry Tew

--- "Fuqua, Andrew (ISSAtlanta)" <AFuqua@...> wrote:
> Perhaps this will help:
>
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit-functionaltests/message/112
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit-functionaltests/message/114
>
> My test Ant stanza looks like this:
>
> <java classname="junit.textui.TestRunner"
> args="net.iss.eventmanager.test.AllTests"
> fork="yes" classpath="${libclasspath};${testclasspath}"
> failonerror="true"
> />
>
> and my main() looks like this:
>
> public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
> //use the following if using junit 3.3.1
> TestResult tr =
> EnhancedTestRunner.runWithTestResult(suite());
> if (!tr.wasSuccessful()) {
> System.out.println("�ber test -- FAILURES BAAAAD!");
> // Let automated build/test process know the test
> failed...
> throw new Exception("TEST FAILED");
> }
> System.out.println("�ber test. Goooood.");
> }
>
> regards
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: perry.tew@...
> [mailto:perry.tew@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 02, 2001 3:50 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] does junit.textui.TestRunner.run return a non zero
> status code? ( junit & ant problem)
>
>
> Hello. I'm learning junit, and I'm working through one of the
> tutorials
> listed on junit.org titled "Incremental development with Ant and
> JUnit".
> The problem I'm having is that when I run ant, my junit reports an
> error,
> but ant reports an overall success. If I add a System.exit(1) to
> the end of
> my main method in my Test program, ant reports a FAILURE. I'm
> following the
> tutorial as it's written, but I can't seem to make ant fail when
> junit does.
> Would someone please look at my build.xml (trimmed), junit code,
> and my
> output and see if I'm making a mistake somewhere?
>
> Thanks for your time,
> Perry Tew
> mailto:perry.tew@...
> 678-415-3823
>
>
> build.xml
> =============================================================
> <target name="test" depends="build">
> <java classname="com.cibavision.asmt.library.test.UserTest"
> taskname="junit" fork="true" failonerror="true" >
> <classpath>
> <pathelement path="${build_base}/" />
> </classpath>
> </java>
> </target>
> =============================================================
>
>
> jnuit code (trimmed)
> =============================================================
> package com.cibavision.asmt.library.test;
>
> import com.cibavision.asmt.library.User;
>
> import junit.framework.*;
> import java.io.*;
> import java.util.*;
>
> public class UserTest extends TestCase {
>
> public UserTest( String name ){
> super( name );
> }
>
> public static void main( String[] args ){
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run( UserTest.class );
> //System.exit(1);
> }
>
> public void testOne() {
> assert( false );
> }
> }
> =============================================================
>

> =============================================================

>
> ... other targets ...
